faqs.question: My Carol City home was built in the 1970s and has aluminum wiring—is that dangerous?
faqs.answer: Aluminum wiring requires attention. When aluminum meets copper—at outlets, switches, and panel connections—the different expansion rates create loose connections that can arc and overheat. We don't necessarily recommend a full rewire, but aluminum wiring does need proper remediation: special AL/CU connectors, COPALUM crimps, or in some cases, targeted copper pigtailing. We'll inspect your home and recommend the most cost-effective solution.

faqs.question: Our Miami Gardens home keeps tripping the main breaker when the AC runs—why?
faqs.answer: This is extremely common in Miami Gardens homes with original 100-amp or 150-amp panels. Modern 3-4 ton AC units draw significant power, and combined with a pool pump, appliances, and electronics, these older panels simply can't keep up. The solution is typically a panel upgrade to 200 amps, which provides headroom for current and future electrical demands. This is one of our most common Miami Gardens projects.

faqs.question: Is my Federal Pacific panel really a fire hazard?
faqs.answer: Yes—Federal Pacific Stab-Lok panels have a well-documented history of breakers failing to trip during overloads. This means wires can overheat without protection, creating fire risk. If your Miami Gardens home has an FPE panel (common in 1970s-80s construction), we strongly recommend replacement. Many insurance companies now require it. We can inspect your panel and provide an honest assessment.

faqs.question: Can you add more outlets in an older Miami Gardens home?
faqs.answer: Yes, and it's one of our common projects. 1960s-80s homes were built with far fewer outlets than modern electrical codes require or families need today. Adding outlets is relatively straightforward and much safer than relying on extension cords and power strips. We can add outlets to any room and include dedicated circuits for high-draw items like space heaters or window AC units.

seoContent.heading: Trusted Electricians Serving Miami Gardens Since 2003

From the excitement of Hard Rock Stadium to the historic campus of Florida Memorial University, this vibrant community deserves electrical service that's equally professional. Solomon Electric has been proud to serve Miami Gardens families and businesses since our founding, building a reputation for honest work, professional service, and genuine expertise. seoContent.heading: Understanding Miami Gardens' Electrical Needs
seoContent.body: Miami Gardens presents unique electrical challenges that require local knowledge. Many homes in neighborhoods like Carol City and Andover were built between the 1960s and 1980s—an era of 100-amp panels and aluminum wiring that can't safely support today's HVAC systems, home offices, and modern appliances. Add South Florida's notorious hurricane season and the constant demand of year-round air conditioning, and you have a recipe for electrical stress. Our electricians understand these challenges because we've spent years solving them for your neighbors.
